alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:39PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water on the Tanana River and Tributaries Draining the Alaska Range Continues This Week... High water on the Tanana River and tributaries draining the Alaska Range will continue this week. This includes the Chisana River, Nabesna River, Gerstle River, Delta River, and the Nenana River. The Tanana River is running near bankfull with minor flooding possible in low lying area over the several days. Heavy rain over the Alaska Range the past week has caused high water on these rivers. Another 0.50 inch to 1.00 inch of rain is expected over the Alaska Range tonight and Monday. This water draining into these already high rivers, and could cause minor flooding over the next several days. A Flood Advisory is in effect through Noon Monday from Delta Junction to Fairbanks, and through Noon Tuesday from Nenana to Old Minto. A Flood Watch is in affect through Tuesday for the Tanana River from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs. Please see those products for more details.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
